sentences.english: Who would have thought a pansy could be such a naughty little flower.
sentences.chinese: 誰曾想到一三色堇可能是這樣一個頑皮的花。

sentences.english: I’m just a naughty boy. I’m a joke-teller.
sentences.chinese: 我只是個頑皮的男孩，一個說笑話的人。

sentences.english: The naughty child dumped his cup of milk in the sink.
sentences.chinese: 那個頑皮的小孩把他那一杯牛奶倒到水槽裏。

sentences.english: The bond maid peeps out to very naughtily smile dimple.
sentences.chinese: 小丫頭露出頑皮的笑靨。

sentences.english: She smiled impishly and didn't look up.
Once upon a time there was a very naughty shepherd boy.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，有一個非常頑皮的牧童。

sentences.english: Where does Heze have selling the naughty pink leopard?
sentences.chinese: 菏澤哪裏有賣粉紅頑皮豹？

sentences.english: He chided the naughty children away.
sentences.chinese: 他把那些頑皮小孩罵走了。

sentences.english: I saw the naughty boy hitting the dog.
sentences.chinese: 我看見那個頑皮的男孩子在打狗。

sentences.english: That is necessary, nowadays naughty kids are all spoiled.
sentences.chinese: 這是應該的，現在頑皮的孩子都被慣壞了。

sentences.english: They become braver and calmer, more fluid and playful.
sentences.chinese: 他們勇敢而沉着，更顯出曲線優美和頑皮。

sentences.english: How wanton thy waters her snowy feet lave.
sentences.chinese: 你的流水如此頑皮，濯滌着她潔白的雙足。

sentences.english: The naughty boy didn't do the physics exercises again.
sentences.chinese: 這個頑皮的孩子又沒做物理題。

sentences.english: Naughty mans at whiles do bad men.
sentences.chinese: 頑皮淘氣的男寶寶有時成爲仁人君子。

sentences.english: This quality may be redundant though; it may be implied by imagination.
sentences.chinese: 頑皮這個素質看上去有些多餘，但它隱含着想象力。
頑皮大膽的小學生會往上爬。

definition: to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to do what one is told/obedient
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
